title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [15–26 september 1871]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [15–26 September 1871]
text: My dear walti have just got your two letters this mondayMonday morning one was written last thursdayThursday and the other on fridayFriday why they haventhaven't arrived before i cannot tell i looked for a letter saturdaySaturday and wondered i didentdidn't get one but as they have come its all well Jeff came here yesterday sundaySunday he stayed to georges saturdaySaturday night and came on yesterday) there was a letter awaiting him here it was from matt she has started for home will be home the first of this week she says for jeff to not shorten his visit to brooklynBrooklyn she is quite well and can get along very well but walt the next is mary has written to know if they can come here for a week as minne is going to be married and they want to get some things she wants me to write if its conveinentconvenient to let them come she says they will get their own grub so i suppose it would be best to let them come or have an everlasting coldness between us all walter dear i dontdon't like to impose on good nature but walt if you could send me the order the first of next week i would be glad as my other sons dontdon't seem to think money is nessessarynecessary for me to have george and loo is coming the 1 of the month good bie walti haventhaven't heard more mrs Hinde if she got the money Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [15–26 September 1871]
